item.title: Gaza solidarity protests sweep U.S. colleges; SCOTUS tackles Starbucks union case
item.description: Tensions are high as campus protests over the war in Gaza stretch across the U.S. The Supreme Court will hear a case about pro-union Starbucks employees.

item.title: What the Starbucks case at the Supreme Court is all about. Hint: It's not coffee
item.description: Starbucks and some of its baristas have been in a contentious fight over unionizing since 2021. Now, the Supreme Court is hearing a case that could have implications for unions far beyond Starbucks.

item.description: There's a referendum on abortion rights on the ballot in Florida in November. President Biden's campaign says that could help buoy his chances there.

item.title: After 26,000 public comments, FTC to vote on rule banning noncompete agreements
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission will vote Tuesday on whether to issue a final rule banning noncompete agreements. The Biden administration has argued that noncompetes harm workers and stifle competition.

item.title: New federal grants aimed to support elections. Many voting officials didn't see a dime
item.description: Voting officials cheered when it was announced that a portion of a multibillion-dollar federal grant program would go to election security. But in many cases, the allocations didn't go as planned.

item.title: 3 Maryland juveniles are charged with hate crimes. How did it get to that point?
item.description: The arrests of the three middle schoolers came last month. Experts say young kids are increasingly exposed to hate ideologies, leaving communities to figure out how to respond.
